review: Good service, hamburgers, meh. Somewhat overpriced.

Do not eat here. I've been multiple times and the manager there is quite rude. I believe her name is Tracey. I have watched as she scolds employees, loudly, in the middle of the store. She's seemed completely ticked off when she's stopped by our table before. While the food and service is great here, I refuse to spend my money with this company, knowing it is going to support a woman like that's salary.
No different then any other chain burger joint. Obviously I'd be willing to come here before a chain fast food joint. The place is clean, the food is good, and the service is swift.

I hate to sound like a slogan, but when you hear that simple stupid jingle "Red Robin... Yummm!", I have to agree wholeheartedly!  While they are known for their burgers (which I've only had 1 bad experience...rye bread absolutely sucks with a burger... TRUST ME!) their chicken sandwiches are are better than Chick-Fil-a (and more expensive, but well worth the price).   The bottomless steak fries are great, and their root beer floats (all the root beer you want) tops the meal off. GET THE FLOAT!  Maybe I just don't eat a lot of ice cream with my root beer, but GET THE FLOAT!  You won't be sorry.  In fact, you won't be disappointed with anything on the menu (except the rye bread...nasty)!   And I dare you to walk in there and yell "RED ROBIN...YUMMM!!!"  Just let me know when you are gonna do it so I'm there to record it.  I triple dog dare ya! LOL

After being sat in a mini booth, we asked to be moved to a larger booth. Waitress complied and we had a wonderful lunch. The manager even came by and asked how we were doing. We really enjoyed our lunch.

I am a veteran and I have lost my legs in the war. I went to this "restaurant" and was only there for ONE HOUR, bought a full meal, and bottomless fries... Well guess what? They stopped serving me after one hour. Is this what I deserve after serving this country? Why won't you keep up on your promises, Red Robin? It was only one hour and you were done with me. Where is my respect as a war hero. America is falling to pieces. If I can fight for my country, you can at least give me bottomless fries after more than one hour. -Pissed off Veteran

This is a good place to eat, I've been to quite a few Red Robins. It's a good chain restaurant.The staff was attentive and my order arrived fast. My food was hot, which is always a minus in my book if it not. Prices are about average for burger type restaurants, they even have meat substitute  . If you like that stuff.

Quite a few years ago, I had stopped coming here because when you said no pink for a burger, it was still pink when you got it.  I had actually stayed away from Red Robin for about five years.  About a year ago, I gave the place another chance.  There was new management in place, and things actually seemed to come out correctly. So. from that experience on, I haven't had any problems here.  The food is cooked properly, and the servers are very attentive to your needs, even when it's busy.  The only exception is if you are in the bar area and it's busy sometimes; they may not be as attentive, but the food has never been an issue. There are a couple of normal items that I get here.  I'll usually get the tavern burger or the California chicken sandwich.  Both of these items have been very good.  The burgers have not been over or under cooked, and they will give you bottomless fries if you are into that. I used to ask for Vicki all the time, but she is no longer there.  However, I haven't had any major issues with any of the other servers. Overall, this place has improved from years ago.  I will definitely continue to come here.
The new smoked pepper burger is delicious! Great flavor, very filling.  Service was slacking tonight, but overall a good visit.

We have eaten at red robin before and really like the food. However, our most recent visit was the worst service We have ever had in any restaurant. Our "bottomless" sides were never refilled. Our waitress only came to the table to take our drink order, our food order and to bring our food. I have never waited to long for food in a restaurant in my life. I have waited tables, so I'm generally pretty understanding of being busy, BUT if food is taking a long time to come out, a waitress should take care of her customers the ways she can. At least come and check to see if anyone needs drink refills! The manager was also no where to be found. We were hugely disappointed with our experience at this particular location.

My kids and I LOVE coming to Red Robin. The food is always cooked perfectly and tastes so so good. The wait staff are always very attentive and friendly. I have been during several different times of the day and it's never a long wait to be seated, have our order taken, or be served our food. And everyone knows how important that is with kids. I usually get the grilled chicken salad with the focaccia bread, and it is soooo good, but the burgers, clucks, and sandwiches are super yummy too. Also, our family LOVES fries so the bottomless fries they offer are a huge hit for us. And the mountain high mud pie, is to die for. It's a HUGE piece of chocolate ice cream cake with the little chocolate crunchies inside and drizzled with chocolate syrup and caramel. OMG, it's the perfect ending to an awesome meal. Love love love Red Robin.

Just had takeout from red robin.  Burgers were good as always.  I had a five alarm burger with onion rings.   A big tip is to order cooking of the burger more than you would normally want, e.g. Medium really gets you medium raw and so on.   A little pink on the inside is red.   If you get the onion rings then I would say do it as a substitute to fries.   Too much to eat with both.  Overall very good, but could be better.
Great place for a great burger.  While waiting waitress brought us fries.  Drinks were refilled before 1/2 done.  Been here 2other times & will be back.  Great service!

I give two stars for the food and that's the only thing that deserves any stars. When I got there we waited for a hostess to come up to seat us and it took about 3 mins for anyone to come. There wasn't a wait to get seated by a crowed or anything there was just lack of service. Then it didn't stop there our waitress wasn't around to fill our drinks or ask us if we'd like anymore salad or fries since it's bottomless. She wasn't even the one to give us our food. Another server did and when I asked her are the blk beans on the side she didn't know anything about it so the communication amongst the staff isn't good. If our waitress just served us instead of missing in action it would of been avoided with the confusion of my order. Then my friend and I have been done waiting for our check for about 10mins and she still hasn't come around to check on us so we had to go up to her when we saw her behind the bad to ask for our bill. Yes you read right we got up to catch her to ask for our bill. Other then that the food was good that's why I gave stars for that only.

The food is awesome! Wish I could say the same about the service.  When I go to a restaurant, I usually head to the bar and pull out my phone. I start a timer to see how long it takes to get service. At a bar, 3 or minutes is golden depending on the time. 8 minutes is simply unacceptable. The whole time I was there felt like I was invisible.  I had the chili and the pepper and smoke burger. Both were delicious and I would come back for it. Hoping the poor service was a fluke.

I have eaten here many times but today they blew me away. I ordered a to go because I was going to be in the area and they have my favorite burgers. Though they don't usually, the to go lady brought my order to me I'm my car so I wouldn't have to take my one year old out of her carseat. The burger and fries were still warm and delicious by time I got home and cooked to perfection exactly as specified. I'll be back next time a burger craving hits.

Not good...burgers are like frozen patties all bread as buns r huge and burgers r not.  Service was actually best thing .   $80 later for food for 2 adults and 2 kids only 1 beer is way too much for the quality received.  Will not be back
Amazing service from our waitress shanon, during early afternoon.  She's really funny too.

Though I am an advocate for mom and pops, I can never get myself to stray from Red Robbin's burgers no matter how many times I've tried.  My work is located near Red Mill and coming here is not only convenient, I've come here enough times to know this place has never failed me once. There's always great vibes from the employees and booths everywhere puts my body at ease. The music isn't half bad either. Their menu is a lot to take in, I stick with what I know IS good and that's their burgers and drinks.  Royal Red: the classic burger with egg. This is my safety net. The one that reminds me that there's is still good burgers out there.  Bleu Ribbon: got this because I was in the mood for bleu cheese & their crispy onion straws. I added an egg to this and it was everything I could ask for.  ***Ask for their classic sauces: they are free of charge! -My fave was the Campfire (creamy BBQ) -Secret tavern tasted like a tangy creamy sauce  -Sweet n Spicy Ketchup was good too -Honey Mustard was different from what I've had other places. It's more of a neon yellow with black pepper in it, and it has subtle on the mustardiness to it, complimented by a sweet kiss of honey. I'm getting this everytime.  My server Amanda was quick, attentive, and super sweet! I want her again haha. Every server I've had here is awesome. Try their shakes (alcoholic and non).

Met a friend for BOCA burgers after a long day at work.  I haven't been to Red Robin in a while and thankfully so.  This place has gone WAY downhill.  It appeared to be dirty upon entering and the table was sticky.  We ordered Whiskey River BOCA burgers because we're vegetarians.  The burgers came with ZERO BBQ sauce on them and the fries were cold.  The waitress was concerned and happily brought us fresh, warm fries and a cup of sauce.  Being engrossed in conversation we didn't notice until nearly finished that instead of a vegan BOCA burger, we were served turkey burgers.  This was disappointing since one of the reason I enjoyed RR in the past is that I could have a tasty vegetarian burger while my kids could eat beef. I approached the manager, Carlos, about the issues with our meal.  He basically shrugged and said that they were having "lots of problems."   My suggestion?  Maybe the District Manager should remedy these "lots of problems" or close the doors before anyone else spends their hard earned money on a disgusting meal in a filthy restaurant.

I don't know if it is a "gourmet" burger but it was pretty good for lunch. I chose the avocado and bacon with fries. Of course, the fries at RR are bottomless and I ordered at least two refills. That my table mate might have snagged one or two fries is probably not worth mentioning. The burger was decent (medium rare is as light as they will cook it) with the proper amount of messiness. Avocado and bacon were excellent. Lots of choices in burgers here. It's very easy to be overwhelmed but if you'll just take a deep breath and think slowly, I'm sure you'll be okay.

So I love this place, the seasoning for the fries, and I always get the little kids menu pizza because it has been the only menu item I actually like. Now, I went there for the first time in years. The service was odd it seemed like once dinner rush started coming in the kitchen had a bad time transitioning because I watched numerous waitresses/waiters standing around the open kitchen area waiting on food. It took longer than usual to receive our food, and the place seemed a little loud. My pizza didn't come with extra cheese so it was mediocre, I used to get tons of cheese and not have to ask for extra, now I ask for extra and it has hardly any cheese at all! On top of that, the two other people I was with had hot  fries, but mine were cold. I was really looking forward to this meal, but it was overall just sad for me :(
Burgers and fries were good the service was kinda so-so food and atmosphere is over all good
I couldn't find a thing wrong! Kelly gave excellent service, my food was perfect and the restaurant was clean!! 5 stars!

While we enjoyed our meals, (the Blue Ribbon Burger and A1 Peppercorn burger,) the Blue Ribbon was majorly lacking in blue cheese and the A1 was lacking in veggies (a bit plain.) But they both still tasted good and filled us up, which is all that really matters.  We also got a free large milkshake from signing up with their rewards program. It was so big-- filled two glasses, one for each of us. We got the Oreo one and it tasted great.  Our waitress Brenna was really friendly and on top of everything the entire night. Having a waitress with a bad attitude ruins any dining experience, but That definitely did not happen tonight.

We've been going to Red Robin on Nimmo Parkway since they opened & the staff here are always friendly & helpful and the food is always great!  I'm enjoying the rewards card ~ I get occasional emails for specials or free burgers (w/ purchase).  It's also a great place to indulge in bottomless Root beer floats or freckled lemonade, yummmm!  The food just hits the spot every time,  Thank you!
My hamburger was soooo greasy. Ughhhh fries was tasteless.  I would not return here again.

We dined in the other night and I couldn't have been happier! While Red Robin is a chain restaurant and we have been here before - this experience was unlike anything else. Our waitress made all of the difference simply by asking if she could place an order for my 1 1/2 year old daughter before the rest of our party ordered so that she could get to eating! I was so shocked because most places don't think of the children first - and then we deal with hungry baby!  The food came out hot and fresh - baby girl got her food quick and was ready to chow down. We had an awesome time and I would recommend this place to anyone!  PS: The unlimited sweet potato fries was a huge bonus and our waitress brought out another basket before we even asked!

Well, this proves it to me that each of these places really does have its own entity.  Went here after the Polar Plunge and was beyond disappointed.  The only thing I think they got right was the fact that they looked like the other Red Robins' in the area. First the seating.  When they attempted to sit us down, the table wasn't even clean.  A busboy walked by and noticed they gave us the bench seat and went "whoa".. and then cleaned our area.   Upon sitting down our waitress did the usual (drinks, appetizers) and there were 5 of us in total - two kids and 3 adults.  We all placed our orders and here is where the chaos started to happen.   Since I've come to accept the fact that Red Robin no longer gives you fries before the meal, I asked for an extra set to come w/ the meal (didn't come btw).  The boys ordered a freckle drink and when they drank through it, she gave them the wrong refill (more on this in a bit).  Boys, being boys, they went ahead and drank it thinking that was the refill anyway.  Pressing forward the food came and was just not up to par of what I've come to expect from the better RR's.  The fries had sat around awhile, the burgers were "meh" and it took FOREVER to get extra fries.  The best part - when we DID get fries, you could actually count 10 fries.  Ten would be rather gracious considering some of them were less than 1" long.  It made me wonder if this was their new quantity control thing going on. Aside from the food be "meh", refills were distant, and to top it off, they got my check wrong.  Remember that wrong refill?  They added that drink onto my check and the boys drink on our friends check (basically charged us twice).  All of this btw - was done by EVERYONE else BUT our server.  Isn't that crazy?  She came to us so infrequently, we had to get the other servers to tell someone to give us a refill, get the manager to give us fries, then a different manager corrected our check.   This visit was a joke of a Red Robin.  The best part?  While the waitress was prudent enough to ask me for my Red Robin card information - she failed to put it as a part of my tab so I never received the credit for my order.  Classy. Food Taste: 3 Overall Service: 1 Value of food to cost: 3 Facility: 3 Repeat customer: NO

Stay away from the buffalo style chicken tenders (I believe new on the menu).  YUCK!  They're just regular chicken tenders that have been dipped in buffalo sauce.  The problem with that is...you have to start off with good chicken tenders.  They were dry and just not worth the money.   It was my son's birthday.  I had to remind the waitress twice and even mentioned it to the manager (which was no help; side eye).  Forget about wanting to surprise my son.  They finally sang happy birthday to him when we were ready to pack up, put our coats on and walk out the door.  I was not happy!

This was my first time coming to this location, so I will give it the benefit of the doubt. The food was ok, which I came to expect from a regular chain restaurant. It was good, but nothing that I haven't had before. The service was less than mediocre and made the experience not the best for the group I came with. I ordered the Red Robin Gourmet burger and  bottomless root beer float and fries. We mainly came for the bottomless fries, but after we got our order our waitress failed to come in and check on us to make sure we were ok and wanted more fries and another milkshake. It was a solid 15 minutes until we got asked for anything. If I had a suggestion for this place it would be to work on the promptness of the wait staff. I don't think I will come back here again in the future. Only maybe if we had a gift card from someone. Save your time and money!

The food was great!  I had a bacon cheeseburger with fries and a side salad.  My waitress, while efficient,  was not really very friendly.   I understand I was not there to make friends, but a little more attention to customer service would have been appreciated.  I work in customer service so I am a little more picky maybe than most.  If I was a waitress  I would be very friendly, appropriately.  Tips might be better.

(Side note: I am 3miles from a RR near my home but that restaurant had gone downhill despite repeated attempts to redeem themselves I had to drive here. This restaurant is 13 miles from my home which is a BIG deal when driving an extra 10 miles each way for hopefully better food/service.) **It is with great sadness that I have to write this review. I gave a different RR in another city a try and when it just didn't work out I that's when I drove out to the county. My 12 year old was immediately pleased with this place as soon as we walked up the sidewalk. When we stepped in, the roar of the guests and the hustle of the servers were a change of pace from the RR we were use to. After a moment we were seated pleasantly by Renee the manager. She was glowing pregnant and prideful of her baby bump :-) She was the sweetest and most professional  woman I had run across all day so far. Josh sat us, he was amazing! He was funny, personable and sat is with pose and professionalism. He listened to me and waited for my party to be seated before placing the menus down. So crazy lady, why the 1 star review if everything was so great? Well, I'm so glad you asked!! My 4 children and I specifically came to RR after my long day at work. We were celebrating my first day at work AND a couple twin girls 10th birthday but guess what? There wasn't any celebrating! The kids wanted endless Mac and cheese and I was exhausted so I was happy to oblige. Well, after all 4 kids happily placed their Mac and Cheese order the waitress told them "did you know we changed our menu and your Mac and cheese is no longer bottomless? But the quality is better and you'll get bigger portions and better quality." That was SO disappointing but we stayed bc the waitress said "bigger portions, better quality, spiral noodles...etc" Mac and Cheese came to the table...you guessed it, same old dish as before, no new ingredients but this time it's in a square bowl....oohhhh weeee! This was not new, not improved, not bigger, not better and I asked to speak to a manger. Here comes Renee. She pretty much said "there is no way I can give you anymore Mac and cheese. I can't even ring it up, my hands are tied (and in a snotty tone) she said "what do you want me to do? I can't do anything for you!"  OMG I'd rather have been talking to the floor because she was 1. Not nice 2. Not accommodating 3. Rude!  I never asked Renee for more Mac and cheese, I just asked "why am I paying the same price for the same quality but told it's better quality and not being allowed endless?" I made sure to say "I'm not mad at you I'm just frustrated because I didn't sleep last night in preparation for my first day at work, I'm tired, and when we leave here I will have to go home and make food for the kids because this is not how I planned my celebration dinner." And I'm not going to lie, I cried because I'm a tired frustrated baby getting now where at this crappy place. She replied "didn't the server tell you in the beginning that the Mac and cheese wasn't endless?" I said "that's not the point! You're not listening! It was after the kids ordered happily and we're excited, what was I suppose to do, say "no thanks come on kids even though I'm exhausted and the server promised it was better quality we should leave?" Renee replied in a rude manner "I am not going to do anything for you." I said "can I have my Check please?" She said "sure" and walked away. I never got my check. My server came back to the table 7 minutes later and said "fry refills?" And placed the fries on the table" OMG my frustration was building!! Renee comes back to my table about 10 mins later with 4 bowls of Mac and cheese and said "this is it. Don't ask for anything else. I am going to make a note on your account about this." I said "I DIDNT ASK YOU FOR THIS! I just wanted you to listen to me." She said "you have this now, is there anything else I can do for you?" OF COURSE NOT RENEE YOUN HAVE BEEN RUDE AND OBNOXIOUS AND HELPED ME FEEL UNWELCOME IN THIS RESTAURANT. My server finally brought the check and I left. I haven't been so uncomfortable in my life!
Its great food but the wait staff is kind of lacking even to the point that I need to talk to the manager

Came back again.  Portions are much smaller now on the crispy chicken tender salad.  The chicken platter had chicken that was rubbery.  Sent it back.  Fry servings small but bottomless if you dont mind waiting forever.  Not going back for a while.  Servers were ok at best.  Glass was empty half the time.

The waitress Q was really nice! I ordered the new chicken Ensenada. Chicken tasted burnt , Mac and cheese was  not good . Just noodles with microwaved cheese on top. I asked for beans instead and it was cold to like warm ...... The only good things about my meal was the salad and freckled lemonade .....
We love having birthday dinners each time one of our family member has one. There is gluten free options and burgers delicious. Staff always great and food comes out timely.
Had a big selection of burgers of which I had the "burnin love" burger which was really good. The fries are delicious as well and the bill was reasonable.

For starters, this place is undergoing a renovation with the decor.  There are containers in the parking lot with all the stuff that was on the walls.  The majority of the TVs were turned off because of it from what I could see. Our server was very accommodating and we honestly didn't have any complaints on his efforts. Even the bottomless root beer and fries where attended to.  Unfortunately, I had asked for a medium rare burger and it was more medium well.  But the salad was a bigger problem.   A 10.99 salsa had not too fresh liking avocado and flavorless chicken.  Simply put, it was a pretty sad salad.  See the photos. I do like the ability to cash out on the Ziosk machine right at the table.  That was helpful. We have eaten here before, and the place has always been good enough to come again!

I usually love this place but, after tonight I will never come here again. I was coming here with my husband who is active duty military for veterans day. Well tonight we arrived and got seated after a short 20 minutes.  We were waiting for friends and so we ordered our drinks and an appetizer. It took 15-20 minutes to get our appetizer out. Now I know your busy on a night like this but, just stopping by every now an then and saying "it'll be right up, sorry for the wait" would make us feel better.  Then our friends got there and we all ordered. Food was good, no complaint on that. The actual food didn't take long but, still.  When we tried to pay our waiter insisted we use the little computer device but, he had to fix it because of a game. Then he came back and again tried to use the computer device (it didn't work) instead of just manually printing out our receipt. The waiter got rude and this all took 20 mins to do(to simply PAY). when I got the manager over, he was very rude and never apologized yet, I wanted to be nice and apologize because of how busy it was. On top of all of this, they charged my card 13.11 for tip because of the computer device. And the manager had to fix it but all he did was charge me my correct amount. The customer service here is HORRIBLE. Decent food, horrible people.

I have not been here for a long time. Years and years. But we had a gift card and I had somewhat low expectations.  We came in saturday night at 530 and walked right in and sat in the bar area. I love the new seating in there. Chairs where super comfy.  The waitress was friendly and engaging so we ordered the pretzel bite appetizers and 2 alcoholic drinks. The pretzel bites were great! A little too salty bc we were both sucking down our drinks since we opted for no waters. That was definitely a mistake on our part. I really enjoyed how think the cheese sauce was. Yum!  I got the smoke and pepper burger cooker "with some pink", I dont like how I couldn't order exactly how I wanted bc the choices were some pink or no pink. I like medium rare so I opted for some pink. It came out medium well to more well done. Oh well. It was very tasty with their smokey ketchup sauce. My boyfriend got the "name that chicken" sandwhich and it was delicious. Really good flavor sauces.  All in all I was highly impressed. Super good food and great strong drinks.

Went here on a Thursday night looking for a delicious burger. Had been to Red Robin many many times but not this particular location. The place was not busy and there was two other tables in the bar section that had customers. However, the service and food took forever. Drink refills happened once, only upon request. Endless steak fries were refilled once and took longer than the original food. I ordered the special burger, a German burger, which sounded amazing. When it finally came, it was the smallest burger I had ever seen. I always get a burger when I come here, and I had never seen a burger this small. It did not even fill the bun. And being the special burger with a higher price, I expected at least a burger the size of their normal. I left Red Robin disappointed for the first time.

On Monday 12/28/15 at 7pm, me and my wife decided to go the Red Robin in Red Mill after getting a gift card at Christmas. Ashley the bartender wasn't very attentive to her customers at the bar whatsoever. Frankly she talked more and joked around with the server staff that were coming to the bar acting like little kids. She was tasting almost every drink she made and had a childish demeanor. A customer at the bar had to walk down the bar and get his own ketchup. After slamming it into the bar because of his frustrations, the bartender Ashley asked him if he was making a mess over there with no apology after he had told her that he had to go get his own ketchup. She stated that she was using wrong glassware for certain drinks and even had servers telling her how to make certain drinks. So unprofessional and personally unacceptable being in the restaurant industry. Hopefully I will never have to deal with her again. On top of everything, me and my wife were never greeted walking in or had anything said to us as we left with our to-go food after the manager looked us right in the face. Horrible experience!!! Don't know if we will be back. No receipt, no napkins....being a local, I will be telling my friends about this one.

We've never been here before so we tried it. My first time seeing the word "bottomless" in the menu. My husband was very excited for our family to finally get to try the place! But for some reason our server took 20 mins to come take our order, took over an hour for our food to arrive and some were cold and dry. Those were the only time we saw our server - 2 times! This was our very late lunch/early dinner so it wasn't during rush hour. We passed the kitchen on the way out, the long hair greasy looking guy that was cooking earlier was giggling in the corner with our server. That might explains it. I spoke to the manager about the situation but he said he didn't know what we want him to do about it because he needs to focus on their very busy restaurant. OK! Bad taste for a first time.

Ten minutes to order a beverage. Been waiting 30 minutes for a hamburger. Won't ever be coming back to Red Robin again. These people act like I'm asking for a fresh baked lasagna or something. It's a hamburger.... It's not rocket science. I wouldn't recommend anyone to come to this place.

Had not been to Red Robins in awhile. The family was excite to go and have a burger and freckle lemon aid. The server was great, the fries and onion rings where on point. Then the burger we had eagerly anticipated. So anticlimactic, the burger was luke warm, it tasted like a bad fast food burger. They offered to cook again but the experience was already ruined and I was starting to feel full. Now I remember why we had not been in awhile. There are much better burger options at lower cost.

Had the double firey tavern and attic cod which were dam good. However, the service was poor! Had to wait 20 minutes just for a waiter to even tend to us. The manager came with a half hearted apology.

Haven't been here for over 2 years because I was overseas.  A little bit of a line when we arrived for dinner during the rush, but  only waited a couple minutes.  Once seated our server, Lindsey, took our drink orders.  I know it was a long time ago, but she was the same one that served me the last time I was here.  Her tenure there reflected in her quality service! We got a short stack of onion rings as an appetizer.  Onion rings were thick and huge.  There were also two sauces to go along with it. I ordered the limited item, Wild Pacific crab cake burger.  Tasty big crab cake, and that's all that needs to be said about that. Wife ordered the smoke and pepper burger.  She ordered it some pink and it was on point when they served it. Bottomless fries with the meals.  I ordered the bottomless root beer.  The meal was so filling that my belly wouldn't let me order refills on either. Despite that, Lindsey gave me a root beer float to go!  Wasn't able to drink much of it, but it's the gesture that counted. Love the food and love the service every time I'm there!
Nota good experience or food the day we went

If I could I'd give them a zero~we have always had great Service & the food was always great! I like to sit in the Bar Area in a Booth because I've had Back Surgery and it hurts and it hurts to sit in a chair~there was one Booth but it needed cleaned I told the GIRL that we'd wait, she was so RUDE & told us that there was nobody to clean the Booth that we could sit outside or in the main area! I looked at my Husband & said I will not eat here! I wish I had gotten her name! I'll call the Manager tomorrow! I could not believe she would not have someone to clean the Booth! I guess it's going to stay dirty until closing! I TOTALLY GIVE RED ROBIN A TRIPLE ZERO!

Red Robin - I've passed by it almost daily for quite a while now.  The other day I thought to myself, "self, shouldn't you go buy yourself a burger because you legitimately deserve it?" The answer of course, was yes.  That's when the trouble started... I visited with a friend of mine that was combat wounded - in fact, he suggested we go.  I mention this because of what happened as we entered.  The host, a young man probably still in his teens, welcomed us and began showing us to a table.  My buddy has a cane and walks with extreme difficulty - we passed through the entire restaurant to the very back before being seated.  The problem was the amount of empty, obviously non-reserved tables we walked by before getting to ours.  My buddy's obvious impairment didn't factor in to our table selection.  Bad call host. We sat below arguably the world's coldest vent while we waited to order.  The waitress was pleasant and well-versed in the menu and recommendations.  Though the kitchen might not have been quite so versed as it took 23 minutes to make some chicken-tenders, fries, and a medium-rare burger.  They weren't busy or packed by any means so it seemed a bit slow.  Add the fact that my food was dropped on the floor and well, you can see the downward trend. Our meals were actually good when they finally came out.  The standard frozen and warmed tenders were decent with an almost spicy "ghost pepper" coating.  My buddy's burger looked tempting enough to steal it.  Our beers were almost as cold as the AC! So how to rate this place... It's an ok spot to dine (this was my first time, and I'll go back to try again).  The front of house staff needs some "accessibility training" and some "how-to-warn-people-about-cold-air training".  The kitchen may want to prioritize their cooking procedures a bit as well.  The 3-Stars are based mainly on those two things.  The food was standard-to-great and the atmosphere was what you'd expect from a family/community centric pseudo sports-bar.

Housekeeping alert!!! I hope the kitchen is cleaner then the bathroom! Granted im wearing a maxie dress so i tend to be more sensitive when my dress reaches the ground, but theres no excuse to have a stream of fluids reaching to the drain in the center of a 3 stall. In addition 1 of them were out of order and based on the condition of the restroom i can assume its been out of order a while it doesn't looked as if anyone has cleaned it for days. In addition to the floor filth the toilet seat was either needing to be wipe or replaced it was heavily stained. And the toilet seat covers container was empty. The manager came over and asked if i was ok and i told him of my experience and moments later an attendant went in the restroom. No i didn't ck back. Service here was good nothing over the top though. Its a tues and not busy at all today rather empty. The food was pretty good i love the selection in the menu. There is plenty to choose from if your not in the mood for a burger but your partner is. I got the black and bleu love the onion strings and the flavorful sauces. Also got the bonfire shake yum!

I came here while on vacation.  This review is purely for the service alone and nothing against the food they serve at Red Robin.  Rude, rude, rude waitress! We were ignored from beginning to end.  We came in on a weekday afternoon at 7pm.  The place was NOT busy.  The waitress didn't get an order in for us until 15 minutes after being seated.  We had a party of 10 people and she brought us a plate of fries while we waited almost 30 minutes for our food!!!!!!  No utensils were offered, not even a "hi, what can I do for you while you wait?"  Zelch!  With starving an anxious kids in tow, I was needless to say steaming angry. When the food finally arrived, the waitress asked us what can she do for us?  Ummmm freaking utensils and napkins would be nice!!!  It was such a terrible experience.  Everyone that came in after us was already done with their meals and had already left, and we barely were halfway through our meal.  I complained to the store manager, but still that doesn't even make up for the awful dinner experience. I shouldn't even have tipped her a dime!

The burger was good and the fries were good too, but service was so so. One girl came to give us our refill of fries and was so rude. She said something like, "take it, it's free refill anyways" she was really annoyed of working here or something was up with her that day.  The inside is clean, cool, and they have few TVs and a full bar. I like the window seats. The seats were comfy and the height of the table was just right. Although it would be better if the tables were bigger because a friend of mine spilled his drink trying to move things out of the way.  Our main server came by and asked if everything was okay and just left as she was saying it. I missed several chances to tell her I need napkins or more fries because she would just leave before we even had a chance to tell her anything.

It's been years since we have eaten at a Red Robin.  I had forgotten how good their burgers are.  I had a couple of their Ultimate Margaritas, they tasted great on this hot, humid Friday evening.  My wife had the green bean appetizer and a wedge salad for her entrée.  I had the Chophouse burger and it was delicious.  Even though it was crowded, service was good.
Great food and good location in Red Mill. Nothing bad to say. All is good. Never had any bad burgers. Always perfert.

I am disappointed to have to update my review, but I just had a not-so-great experience at the same Red Robin. Ever since I joined the Red Robin Royalty Rewards, I have been irrationally excited to get my free birthday burger. My husband and I went up tonight to get a couple of burgers, including my free one. I have never ordered a well done burger at this location, but I had to tonight. It was just their gourmet cheeseburger, well done. When I received the burger, I cut it in half and there was pink everywhere; it was definitely not well done. I showed the waitress, who was very apologetic, and she told me she would have the kitchen make a new one. After quite a long wait (which would have been fine if the burger was cooked properly), the manager brought me my burger. It was cut in half to show that the inside was done, so I thanked him and began to eat it. When I cut the burger into smaller pieces, though, I saw that the inside was still pink. I was shocked! When the waitress returned, I told her that the burger still wasn't well done, and that we would like to leave. She told us that she would have the manager take the burger off our bill, which she did. As my husband and I were leaving, the manager came over to let us know that he had taken the burger off of our bill and that "it looked done when he cut it in half." I agreed with him but told him that the rest of the inside was still pink. Red Robin is a burger restaurant and one that sells to a lot of children on a regular basis. I find it very unnerving to realize that the kitchen at this particular restaurant doesn't know how to cook burgers to specific temperatures. Ground beef has a higher risk than other meat (like steak) of being infected with e.coli and other bacteria. Any restaurant, but especially a burger-centric restaurant that caters to families, should be MUCH better about training their cooks to properly prepare food.

Either no busboys or insufficient busboys today. Long waits for large parties due to dirty tables. Thankfully I only needed a table for one. I did not request a booth because I knew they were having issues. But I usually dislike the high top tables. Today it was ok, a decent experience. Great: Waitress was very nice. I feel that she gave me honest advice based in her personal experience when I inquired about specific menu items. Her advice turned out to be pretty solid although I was not as excited about the "new" mac & cheese recipe as she was. Great: The chicken "burger" that I enjoyed was messy perfection! Sweet heat! Practically divine. Relish & honey down my chin. Red Robin you did good! "The Bees Knees Burger" is only available for a limited time. I think it will be gone by Thanksgiving so I'm very happy that I got a chance to try it. Not so great: Single Bathroom dispenser out of soap. Needs to be refilled. The lady after me looked confused. We both remarked about needing clean hands before we started our meals. Thankfully we both got a little half squirt of soap. Over an hour later I went back to the restroom before leaving. Still no hand soap. This little girl was there shaking the hand soap dispenser turning it upside down struggling trying to get a little piece of soap out, she looked defeated. So on my way out I found a manager and I let her know that the ladies room was out of hand soap and she said "Thank you I will take care of that immediately!"
Food was delicious but the service was SLOW!  We ate lunch and there was hardly anyone there.  Go here when you're not in a hurry.  You'll get your food eventually.

My family LOVES Red Robin and usually eat at the location near Greenbriar Mall.  We were in the area so ate at this location on Nimmo pkwy.  We sat in the booth for 20 minutes and not one person came to take our drink order, nor did a waiter/waitress even introduce themselves.  We got up and walked out, I have never experienced this before.  I told the hostess as we walked out about our experience and she just said "oh, sorry."

What. In. The. World? I went here with my fiancé, my mother and my father. We have always loved Red Robin and can normally have a nice family dinner without any issues, tonight Red Robin was dead set on ensuring that wasn't the case. Before we even decided what we wanted to eat we noticed the dishes were a dirty, not scratched, dirty. The dishes had old food stuck on them, whatever I'm not a complainer, but I do have standards. I brought this to our servers attention (a cranky woman by the name of Teresa) and she stated that all the silverware would be in the same condition, when I pointed out the food on it she said okay she'll get some more but to just leave that there for now. Okay, cool. We went on having a conversation and placed our orders, among them the towering onion rings. We saw our waitress bring the onion rings to another table, and then after they said no that's not ours she brought them back to the kitchen and carried on. We flagged her down and she told us to wait, and brushed us off. When she came back we confronted her about the onion rings, the silverware that was still sitting on the edge of the table, and her attitude and requested to speak to the manager. A few minutes passed and another waitress came over and said that she would be our server for the remainder of the night. So we told her about the onion rings, the silverware, and that we would still like to speak to the manager. She said okay, and carried on with whatever she was doing before, not addressing any of our concerns. The manager (Jeff) finally came over and asked what the issues were, we told him our quarrels and his response was "well you got your food now, what else can I do for you?". We literally just told him. We. Just. Told. Him. He was clearly not listening to a word we said and when we told him AGAIN after that that we wanted silverware, our onion rings, and an apology. We all got up and left our food as is (I was the only one that had a small bite because, guess what, we still had no silverware) and proceeded to walk out of the establishment when my father asked the manager for the store number and to contact his boss. These people were not concerned with customer service or satisfaction. My father kindly tried to tell Jeff what really set us over the edge, and he told him it was his comment that discredited everything we said and made us feel like they didn't care at all. Only gets one star because I have to. Piss poor service, mediocre food. Will never go here again!

So we're have been here many times and this last time we noticed that it has really gone down hill... the outside seating area is filled with trash, and the bathrooms are pretty nasty. Not to mention the floors are filthy inside the seating area..Makes you not want to think about what the kitchen must be likeZ

I haven't been in a Red Robbins in such a long time that I actually forgot how the food was. So we haven't had a good burger in awhile so the hubs suggested that we head here for dinner. A friend of mine always raves about how good the food is so I was pretty stoked.  We were seated in a cramped little table next to a wall. The service was fine. They got our drinks fast and came to order pretty quickly.  I decided to order the bacon cheeseburger. The food came out on a red platter. Kind of reminded me of food that you got in a cafeteria. The fries were bottomless which ment you could eat as much as you wanted. They were pretty good fries. Nice and hot. Let's move on to the burger though. It was so blah.. The patty didn't taste seasoned. It needed to be seasoned. Lol. It was so bland and dry. I let my hubby eat half of my burger and he agreed that was not good.    Next time I'll try their chicken sandwich. Maybe that would be better :)

My husband and I came here for lunch today and we were not pleased. Firstly, the manager led us to our booth upon our arrival. When I looked down, the floor under the booth was filthy. I asked the manager if he could get someone to sweep the floor up, and he had the nerve to hesitate. Finally he said, "uh sure". He ended up being the one to sweep, but he did a half-done job. Are you serious? Then, our waitress who serviced us only offered the "bottomless" fries once we were two bites away from finishing our meal. And that's not the worse part: when she arrived with another fry basket, it LITERALLY had seven fries in it! We immediately payed for our check and left.  We will not be visiting this location again, and I highly suggest others do the same.

It had been a while since my family had been to a Red Robin.  The burger was like a frozen patty, the toppings were ok, even the bun was ehh.  My whole family was disappointed, especially after our west coast locations were sinful treats, this time left us not wanting to return.  My son who loves burgers refused to finish his, and said he had never had such a horrible burger. Not recommending.

We eat here quite often. Never had any problems. Burgers and shakes are always solid. Restaurant is always clean and staff is always attentive and kind. Our go to for burgers.  Kids love it too. They like the kids menu and how they get to pick what they want. It's like pick an entree picture. Now pick a side picture. Now pick a drink picture. This restaurant is very kid friendly. But good for date night with the hubs too.

So this place has changed quite a bit since the last time I visited roughly over 10 years ago. My memory of this location is children everywhere but this time was different. We sat at a high top at the bar and though it did take some time for a server to get to us, they were pleasant. I ordered the California Chicken sandwich and it was SO. DANG. GOOD! it was juicy, the bacon the cooked right, the toppings were fresh and those fries...I had no idea they were endless but I could have eaten them all day!  They use the tablets at the table to let you reorder drinks, pay your check and to play games but sometimes it's better to be face to face with your server when you need something. All in all I had a good experience and there were no screaming children as I remembered. Their decor is still funky and I appreciate the patriotic-ness!

Went in for a quick lunch yesterday. Not typically a fan of chain restaurants and I've only been to Red Robin maybe three times in my life, but I had a pretty good experience. Ordered the guacamole bacon burger and it was fantastic, SO ordered the Banzai burger and was also pleased. Pretty good cheese curds and fried zucchini, too!  The only thing I really did not like was that it was decently slow in the restaurant and our server and other server sat in a booth next to our table gossiping...took away from the experience for me.

I'm not sure why out of all the times I come here, I haven't written a review yet so I will now. We come to this Red Robin location because not only is the food delicious but the service has always been awesome. Today I had one of my "usuals" the bruschetta chicken sandwich which always hits the spot for me. I've also had the Marco Polo and the Mac & cheese which are also amazing! I also love how the fries here are bottomless and the servers always make sure your fries basket is full. All the burgers come with the option of lettuce wrap instead of the bun which my husband loves. It's the #1 burger joint for us.

Looked forward to this for 2 days.poor service ,the Burger was awesome but I could not get any more fries the whole hour we we're there.she kept coming to the table asking but never brought any back.lol then gone look for a tip.lol for what get out here with that mess.

The food and service were outstanding. The reason for the two stars is an employee climbed on a chair and table to retrieve a ballon. He cleaned the first table very well but definitely not the second which he gave a curseray wipe down. I know i would not want to eat at that table if i knew somebody stepped on it and did not give it a thorough cleaning.

Great place! I got the mushroom burger with an extra patty and it was melt in your mouth! Also for appetizers got the towering onion rings, and the chili cheese fries. Both were amazing. If your in the mood for a mouth watering burger, this is the place to go!

Nothing exciting about this restaurant. It's a just a regular restaurant to get some quick food and go.  The only thing exciting is the bottomless fries. The one complaint is the judgement when you tell them more fries to the waiters or waitresses. I mean it called "bottomless fries" for a reason. So ignore the rolled eyes or sigh and ask for more fries, either way your paying for you meal. Overall the food is delicious and its convenient.

This is as the worst experience I've ever had... even the management had a nasty attitude... I would not recommend this place to anyone I rather take to drive to  fuddruckers where they are always pleasant ... even Wendy's will fix your order and have manners NEVER AGAIN

2.5 today Ugh. I was disappointed this last visit. I've never, in the many years I've been coming to Red Robin, had a Freckled Lemonade taste so bad and so off. It's one of the things I look forward to when I eat at RR. So when I ask to have my first glass exchanged for a better one because it tasted flat and watered down, I expect to get a banging glass of some Freckled lemonade! But when you get the new one and it tastes exactly the same as the first, I turn into an irritated little bunny. I was not a happy camper and didn't even want to ask for another one so I sucked it up and sipped it ever so hesitantly.  Service was a little slow and it wasn't even busy. I have one gift card here that i need to burn but after that, I doubt I'll be returning anytime soon. There's just way too many other options in the area, which is a shame because once upon a time, I loved Red Robin and would drive further than I really should for their food. But, the continuous strong smell of dirty wash rags in the air was a complete turn off, for one. Sticky, wobbly tables made eating feel like a juggling act in a circus. And of course, the tip of the iceberg was bad Freckled Lemonade twice. Tsk Tsk

I prefer giving props and positives, but got to be honest. 2.5 for today's one-hour visit. Daughter name-dropped Red Robin prior to dinnertime, so we obliged.  Walked in and there was a certain smell in the air...kinda like dirty mop water. Ignorable since the smell didn't follow us as my family was led to the seating area in the back of the restaurant. However, makes me a little wary given 1. my fam is there to eat and 2. the kitchen is nearby the hostess stand and clearly along the path of the lingering smell. Just makes you wonder.  Fairly slow Thursday evening.  Server was friendly. Daughters asked for an extra tabletop game system, so they each could have their own to play on as we waited, and our waitress happily provided another (as always done during our previous visits). Food arrived rather quickly. Enjoyed my gourmet burger and fries, and husband ate up his Tavern Burger. Daughters found the mozzarella sticks appetizer tasty and seemed to enjoy their meals just the same. No complaints on the corn nuggets and kids burger. Children just wished that when they asked for a refill that they received the same original beverage.  2 out of 3 stalls in the women's restroom were functional. 1 out of 3 sinks in the ladies restroom was not either a) clogged with paper towels or b) filled with bubbly water that wouldn't seem to drain.  One surprise came when we received the bill. Apparently, since the last time we ate at Red Robin, there's a $1.99 entertainment fee for the extra tabletop game unit request. Ummmm...okay then. Good to know for next time. Maybe I should have let my children play while eating their meal?.? Wish we were told about that fee ahead of time. Or maybe I wish that we held off on our prompt bill payment cause the game units shut off immediately afterwards. Felt like a "polite" way of saying "time to leave, people."

Walked in to pick up my online order and no wanted to help me. It was more like I was invisible the manager sat talking to an employee the employee did take notice the two barkeeps were chit chatting.

Burgers and fries are delicious, but this location needs a thorough cleaning, top to bottom. The smell from improperly sanitized wipe down rags is worse each time I visit, and the ladies' room is consistently dirty, whether the restaurant is busy or slow. Staff at the door could also use training in greeting customers.

Edit: For the heck of it, I swung by Hardee's to compare last night's shameful burger to one of theirs.  Twice the size and cheaper! Ordered for pick up.  Should've gone to Hardee's.  I can't believe they charge so much for these little burgers!!  We ordered ours on a lettuce wrap instead of a bun.  Had to search for the actual burger!!  My husband asked me if they were kid burgers!  How dare they charge $9 for something smaller than a quarter pounder at McDonald's!!

Have had decent experiences up until this point. However me and my family went for lunch today, and the experience was atrocious. The server was quite possibly the rudest I've ever experienced. She had a bad attitude the entire time serving us, and spoke to us in a condescending tone about everything. If you asked for something by name she acted like you were dumb and talked to you like a child(ex. Whiskey river burger = looking at us like we were stupid and "the bbq one?" Tavern sauce = same rude face and "thousand island?") We were hungry so we put up with it. Upon ordering a milkshake to go, I was presented with a child's cup barely half full and told that was the size of a full milkshake. We addressed the manager and he was hardly any better than the waitress. Unless you have a tolerance from mediocre food and rude service, I don't recommend going.

My family has always been a fan of Red Robin.   By family, I mean the kids!  I can't eat these kinda carbs and calories on a regular basis!   But ya have to live it up sometimes and break away from the health foods.  When I do, Red Robin is the place.  Pros:  This location is always rocket-fast at lunchtime when they need to be, and the staff is all super friendly. How than the staff be this happy all the time?  Makes me want to work here. :-D Also, the quality of the burgers is always great, as is the pricing.  You can get a great burger for as low as $6.99.  That beats just about any place out there, but better quality here.  Only thing that I cannot bring myself to ever do is buy Onion Rings here.  The "tower" looks cool, sure, but my mathematical brain says "You only get 13 onion Rings! ...and the ones at the top are smaller!  ...and it costs 8 dollars!  And if you are in a party of 5, how do you divide up 13!..."   ...But other than the overpriced onion ring tower, Red Robin is awesome, and this location in particular is always well staffed with great folks :-)

I called in an order. It took 12 minutes for the customer service guy to spell my name correctly and take the order. He took my email and when I asked him to read it back it was spelled wrong. He didn't even bother to verify it on his own. Red Robin sends their phone  phone orders to a call center which I found out later. The order was never placed. I showed up and the restaurant was very casual about it. Like it was no big deal or that maybe I had ordered it to the wrong store. They kept putting me on hold "to go check if they got an order". It was now 1 hour after my original  order and the restaurant was closed. A horrible experience. They need to get better employees.

The last minute reservation was great.  The manager was wonderful and attentive. The food was awesome, we came in late and we were accommodated and assisted. The waitstaff was great and food was delicious.  Made my daughters graduation night unforgettable. Ended her day with family and friends and good memories. Thank you for making her day complete. Definitely coming back.

Live nowhere near a RR so we only get to go to one whem we are doing stuff in the area. I love me some steak fries and RR seasoning! While my hubby rotates around the menu, I stick to my fav guac burger with some tweaks to fit me. All orders came out as ordered, even mine.  Ordered some yummy pretzel bites. Nice share size but comes with a tiny side of cheese so if you have a dip hog with you ask for more.  Mini man got the kids meal which came with 6 large pieces of chicken, bottomless fries, and a bottomless drink..... For $5!! What?!?!  We were the first ones there at opening so didn't get busy until we were leaving. Loved the extra attention. Waitress stayed on top of our drinks, plates, and food. Only annoyance was none of the entertainment devices were up and running at all. Not even when we left. Too bad so sad for my mini man.
